1. It is an instant way to relieve tension as well as anger and anxiety. 

2. It is quite an effective breathing technique for all those people who are suffering from hypertension since this technique calms down the agitated mind. 

3. It provides relief to a person in case he is feeling hot or have a mild headache. 

4. It also improves the concentration and memory of the person. 

5. It is effective in building confidence. 

6. It makes the mind calm as well as peaceful. It is beneficial in agitation, heart disease, high blood pressure etc. 

7. If this pranayama is practiced by a pregnant woman on a regular basis, it could facilitate in easy as well as trouble-free childbirth. 

8. This pranayama is quite helpful in paralysis. 

9. The humming sound facilitates the concentration of the mind. It has a positive effect on the entire body and mind, especially on the nervous system. 

10. It helps in balancing blood sugar. 

11. It is quite beneficial for people suffering from Alzheimer. 

12. This pranayama is extremely beneficial for heart patients since it helps in maintaining the overall working of the cardiovascular system. 

13. The humming vibrations of this pranayama activate the pituitary gland which is among the major glands in the body. 

14. It can cure insomnia.

1. Make sure that you do not put the finger or thumb in the interior of the ear, just on the cartilage. 

2. Don’t press too hard on the cartilage of the ear. Just press the cartilage gently, and then release the finger or thumb. 

3. When you make humming sound, make sure that your mouth is closed. 

4. Always perform this pranayama in a seated position and never do it while lying down. 

5. In case you have an ear infection, then you shouldn’t perform this pranayama until the infection is gone. 

6. People with heart problems shouldn’t hold their breath when they are practicing this pranayama. 

7. You should never force the breathing.
